sub_title: Business Coach and Consultant, focused on Operations (ITSM Expert), Technology and Digital Marketing
summary:
Experienced Director with a broad set of skills in departmental and team development, coaching, IT strategy, service management, service operations, infrastructure management, server/cloud architecture, project management, etc.  

I have a focus on mentoring and creating independent teams that are able to orchestrate and deliver.

projects.title: Citrix CloudBridge POC
projects.description: Citrix CloudBridge enables enterprises to software-define their WANs by combining the intelligence of WAN virtualization, WAN optimization and application management into one comprehensive solution. With CloudBridge SD-WAN, enterprises can ensure application availability while reducing delivery costs.

projects.title: FlexPod Implementation for Dev and test
projects.description:
FlexPod is a integrated computing, networking, and storage solution developed by Cisco and NetApp. Its configurations and workloads are published as Cisco Validated Designs. FlexPod is categorized by established and emerging client needs:

FlexPod Data Center was developed for large enterprises.
FlexPod Express serves small and medium-sized enterprises.
FlexPod Select focuses on high capacity and performance for specialized workloads.
Cisco and NetApp support FlexPod deployments through the Cooperative Support Model.

ITIL Foundations Certificate in IT Service Management

profile_positions.description: Orchestrador's mission is to provide Transformational Coaching and Consulting to help driven individuals and businesses succeed by sustainably reaching their goals. We strive to provide our clients with the knowledge and resources they need to reach their goals while also helping them and challenging them to develop the skills needed to maintain their success over the long term.
profile_positions.title: Business Owner

profile_positions.description:
- Executive Summary: As a Director of Product Management within the Customer Engagement Product team (CRM), I work as an individual contributor, reviewing and clarifying enhancement requests from our clients and ensuring that there were adequately translated to our Salesforce developers to ensure that the final delivery would be satisfactory.

- Responsibilities:
	- Ownership of multiple Salesforce components
	- Review and maintenance of the Enhancement request backlog
	- Creation of functional requirement documents for our Salesforce developers
	- Review of the deliverable enhancement by the developers
	- UAT of any enhancements related to the components I own

- Achievements:
	- I reviewed the current process for enhancement request creation, identified the gaps, and created a plan to ensure that complete information was delivered to the product team for our assessment.
profile_positions.title: Director of Product Management

profile_positions.description:
- Executive Summary: As Director of Application Management, I was part of the Global Service Operations leadership team. The focus was to ensure that processes and procedures adequately catered to the needs of all the groups involved while ensuring ITIL best practices.
 We would help on escalations, analyse the current situations, determine the root causes, provide guidance to the teams involved and, if necessary, create or modify existing processes and train the teams as needed. We would cater for a team of over 500 people, supporting over 260 clients and a mix of SaaS systems and custom legacy software solutions.

- Responsibilities:
* Ownership of any escalation assigned to us by the leadership team.
* Work as Subject-matter expert in ITIL, Project Management, ITSM, and Release Management.
* Bridge operational gaps between internal teams with straightforward and easy to follow processes based on best practices
* Coach and mentor my team members when faced with operational and people challenges
* Develop, present and deliver strategic plans for complex multi-departmental challenges.
* Work as a functional expert of Salesforce Service Cloud.

- Achievement:
	- Implementation of macros, automatic follow-ups, problem management and purpose-driven metrics within Salesforce Service Cloud, bringing considerable efficiencies and improving staff and client satisfaction.
	- Created detailed roles and responsibilities for an entirely new set of operational functions within the Global Service Operations organisation and presented them and recorded training for all members and future onboarding.
	- Created a new project implementation to support the transition process that ensured that the right stakeholders owned all the correct steps, that the proper milestones were set and that a formal acceptance meeting was taking place, ensuring that incomplete projects were not transitioned to support.
profile_positions.title: Director - Application Management

profile_positions.description:
- Executive Summary: As Director of Global Support, I was in charge of primarily overseeing the Service Operations of all Commercial Compliance customers, supporting a range of reporting, engagement management, grant management and consent management applications. I was in charge of an organization spread between New York, New Jersey, Virginia, Amsterdam, Madrid, Hong Kong, India and Manilla, with a total of 70 .Net Developers, 20 Client leads, and 40 Support Analysts covering Tier 1, 2 and 3, as well as a team of 4 release managers.

- Responsibilities:
* Review of RFPs to ensure compliance with our support offerings
* Management and reporting of KPIs, including but not limited to average ageing of tickets per type, SLAs and client satisfaction (CSAT)
* Ensuring process adherence on service request fulfilment, incident management, problem management and change management.
* Ensuring the proper identification of out of scope service requests
* Closely work with Customer Success to ensure client satisfaction
* Take part in Quarterly business reviews with our top customers
* Work as an ITIL, Release management and SDLC process expert
* Collaborate closely with our implementation team, to make sure the proper transition of systems into support
* Work as an escalation point for the senior clients and internal stakeholders
* Management of L3 Team of Software developers supporting all legacy custom apps.

- Achievements:
* Migration of Zendesk and inhouse SMART tool to Salesforce Service Cloud, including configuration, training and ticket migration of 1200 open tickets, of a client base of around 60 customers, and around 120 custom applications. The project also included client onboarding and training.
* Full ownership of planning and implementation of an offshoring project that sent 50% of onshore roles to a low-cost location, including HR requirements for redundancies, hiring of new staff, training and client management during this transition.
profile_positions.title: Director - Global Commercial Compliance Support

profile_positions.description:
- Executive Summary: Polaris is a small company, it had a vivid startup culture, in which I had to ensure that the Support operations were working efficiently, ensuring the highest possible levels of quality, but I also had to be part of the CS team, working closely with the account managers, negotiating renewals as well as new business opportunities. Also worked very close to implementation, to ensure that the delivery of the systems was as clean as possible before entering support, and was asked to validate the strategy of our cloud infrastructure based on my System Administration and System Engineer background.

- Responsibilities:
* Management of two outsourcing partners based in India, that provided us with Software developers (around 80 resources).
* Management of the Application Support Analyst team covering Tier 2, and distributed between New Jersey, New York, Amsterdam and Hong Kong
* Management of the Software development Tier 3 team with around 70 developers and 10 testers based in India plus 5 resources in New Jersey and 3 in Amsterdam.
* Management and reporting of KPIs, including but not limited to average ageing of tickets per type, SLAs and client satisfaction (CSAT)
* Support customer success with client escalations or RFP negotiations.

- Achievements:
* Implementation of the knowledge management strategy within Tier 3.
* Implementation of Service Level Objectives for Tier 3 so that their effectiveness could be quantified. In that way, allowing us to develop a continuous improvement strategy.
* Creation of a documented support estimation calculator to ensure standardisation based on software under support, client size and client needs. This allowed us to better staff ourselves to guarantee the quality of service and client satisfaction.
* Creation and delivery of specialised ITSM training for our account managers, to ensure they could drive customer success while fully understanding our contractual commitments and our internal processes.
profile_positions.title: Director - Global Support

profile_positions.description:
- Executive Summary: I was promoted to Senior Manager with the addition of APAC to my portfolio, which added the support of Japanese clients.

- Responsibilities:
* Management and hands-on support of all EMEA clients.
* Management of initially a team of 3 members, that grew to 6 after some departures and new hires.
* Serve as an SME of all Compliance Software that we provided to our clients.
* Oversight of all ITSM, including problems, incidents, Service Requests and Change management.
* Management and reporting of KPIs.
* Attend client sites when needed to build close relationships with our clients.
* Take part in any audits from customers under support or at the RFP stage.

- Achievements:
* Establishment of a two-person team in our newly created office in Hong Kong, including direct management of the recruiting and onboarding.
* Creation of a robust release management process, as we had serious quality issues with every custom product update.
* Creation of the release manager role, including role definition, training and close management while the staff member became fluent operationally. The creation of this role drastically improved the quality and order of our releases, considerably improving client trust and satisfaction
profile_positions.title: Senior Support Manager - EMEA and APAC

profile_positions.description:
- Executive Summary: I was hired to stabilise and grow the EMEA support operations, as the company was having severe struggles with the quality of support.

- Responsibilities:
* Management and hands-on support of all EMEA clients.
* Management of initially a team of 3 members, that grew to 6 after some departures and new hires.
* Serve as an SME of all Compliance Software that we provided to our clients.
* Oversight of all ITSM, including Problem, Incident, Service Requests and Change management.
* Management and reporting of KPIs.
* Attend client sites when needed to build close relationships with our clients.

- Achievements:
* Creation of a complete ITIL compliant SOP, with processes, and detailed procedures including workflows, service definition pages, service catalogues, etc.
* Implemented Confluence as a knowledge base as well as creating and implementing a knowledge management strategy based on ITIL best practices.
* Analysed and reconfigure Zendesk to make use of all available automation, macros and capabilities to optimise our efficiency with outstanding results.
* Built online training on processes around incidents, problems, service requests and change management, as well as how to apply them properly using Zendesk in the most efficient way.
* Based on the radical improvement of the European support team within the first 6 months, we were able to save our second biggest EMEA client that was ready to end the contract due to poor quality of support, and 6 months after that, we sold them the largest support contract we had sold.
profile_positions.title: Support Manager - EMEA and APAC

profile_positions.description:
- Executive Summary: After I left, due to the large and complex workload, my role was divided between two people, a Systems Manager and a Support Manager. After my arrival in Europe, I remotely worked on mentoring my replacements. Primarily focused on mentoring calls, advising on reporting regarding project updates, service health updates and decision making.

- Responsibilities:
* Have daily online stand-ups with the new Systems Manager and the new Support Manager to review progress and answer questions.
* Attended all team meetings that the two managers were running with their respective teams, and provided mentoring and coaching to them after.
* Worked as a technical SME of the infrastructure when needed.
* Provided written reports to the CIO and IT manager on the health of the operations, and had a weekly call with the IT manager to discuss.

- Achievements:
	- My only achievement was my primary goal, the teams that were previously reported to me felt little to no operational impact, and the quality of service was maintained for our end users.
profile_positions.title: IT Strategy Consultant

profile_positions.description:
IT Systems and Support Manager - Tenure: Nov '11 till Jul '15
- Executive Summary: This was my first senior management role as I was fully responsible for all production systems and the underlying infrastructure of JJ Richards and Sons and any of the companies owned by them. This role provided me with a very large spectrum of experience across many industries, like transport, mining, logistics, waste management, medical supplies, environmental services and oil refineries. The role was very hands-on, challenging and exciting, as I was able to truly influence the decisions while being challenged by an extremely knowledgeable IT manager as well by the CIO that personally mentor me.

- Responsibilities:
*Management of the Support, Systems Admins and System Administrators, totalling 16 staff members.
*Operational oversight of all production systems at the software and infrastructure level, ensuring 99.9% availability.
* Management of the Support team and ensure the achievement of the SLAs.
* Weekly report of support statistics as well as project status to the IT Manager and CIO.
* Technical subject matter expert across the ecosystem.
* Supplier management for all contracts related to software and hardware required by the company.
* Disaster recovery design and ongoing testing.
* Backup and recovery design and ongoing testing.
* Oversight of all company sites across Australia and New Zealand, at that moment a total of around 40+ sites

- Achievements:
* Based on the Disaster recovery and backup structure that I designed and regularly tested, we were able to overcome a ransomware attack without paying any money or losing only data input between 5 am and 7 am the morning of the attack. At the same time, many large Australian businesses were attacked and had to pay to release their data.
* Please see Project for additional achievements.
profile_positions.title: IT Systems and Support Manager

profile_positions.description:
- Executive Summary: As Head Systems Administrator, I had my first taste in management, I was made responsible for one other SysAdmin, but was tasked to create a robust team that could ensure we solved the many performance issues while keeping up with any incoming acquisitions.

- Responsibilities:
* Oversight, support and maintenance of our entire systems and infrastructure, including security.
* Management of the SysAdmin team.
* Reporting of KPIs

- Achievements:
* Implementation of Sophos Enterprise solution across all endpoints as well as the configuration of the enterprise management
* Migration of 80+ Windows Server 2003 to Windows Server 2008r2
* Virtualisation of 20 legacy physical servers
* Expansion of the Systems Administrator team from 2 to 4 team members, including recruiting and onboarding.
* Growth of the SysAdmin team from 2 to 4 resources.
* Selection, purchasing and installation of a set of HP hosts to work as a virtual test environment for our Development team.
profile_positions.title: Head Systems Administrator

profile_positions.description:
- Executive Summary: As a Support technician, I was responsible for providing helpdesk style support via phone and remote management tools on daily basis with occasional site visits to our sites across Australia and New Zealand. The role was mixed between the traditional Tier 1 and Tier 2. I was reporting directly to the Senior Systems Administrator. This position was great for me as it allowed me to learn an incredible amount of IT and business knowledge.

- Responsibilities:
* Ticket Management via our ServiceDesk tool
* Over the phone support
* Support for Windows, XP, Vista, 7 and 10.
* Support of Windows Server 2003 and 2008r2, including IIS, DHCP, DNS, and Active Directory.
* Support of Citrix Metaframe 4.5, including installed apps and streamed apps.
* Hardware support of mobile phones, smartphones, laptops, desktops, thin clients and specialized truck computers.

- Achievements:
* I became the best performing Analyst and from early on, I worked hard on documenting our environment, allowing us to better analyze and support our systems and end-users.
* With one-hour training, I had to take an interstate trip to install our newly custom-built truck computers, and even when facing serious challenges and working from 1600 until 800 the next day, I was able to deliver the trucks with their new systems working as intended.
profile_positions.title: Support Technician

profile_positions.description:
As a Support Agent, I was responsible of providing call center style support via phone to the United States of America.
This position helped me to greatly improve my telephone skills.
profile_positions.title: GE Support Agent

profile_positions.description:
As a Spa Attendant, I was responsible of providing 5 star level customer service to very prestigious guest with high expectations.
This position helped me to greatly improve my customer service skills and to maintain a high level professionalism.
profile_positions.title: Spa Attendant

profile_positions.description: Worked as an online poker player for an. online casino start-up
profile_positions.title: Poker player
